<ol>

 <li> Consider a <u>deterministic</u> RSA Oracle that is implemented at the server “cryptlygos.pythonanywhere.com/RSA_Oracle/<em>&lt;your_id&gt;</em>”. When connected to the server, you will be sent a ciphertext and expected find out the corresponding plaintext .<strong>  </strong>You can query the RSA Oracle with any ciphertext , and you will be given the corresponding plaintext . You can send as many queries as you want as long as <strong>.</strong></li>

</ol>

You can use the Python code RSA_Oracle_client.py to communicate with the server.

<ol start="2">

 <li>Consider the RSA OAEP implemented at the server http://cryptlygos.pythonanywhere.com/RSA_OAEP/ &lt;your_id&gt;. The server will send you a ciphertext (c), public key (e) and modulus (N). The RSA-OAEP implementation at the server is given in the file “py”, in which the random number R is an 8-bit unsigned integer.</li>

</ol>

I select a random four decimal digit PIN and encrypt it using RSA. You need to connect to the RSA encryption server that challenges you with . Your mission is to find the randomly chosen PIN. You can use the Python code RSA_OAPE_client.py to communicate with the server.
